verses.verse: O God<WH430>, my heart<WH3820> is fixed<WH3559>; I will sing<WH7891> and give praise<WH2167>, even with my glory<WH3519>.
Awake<WH5782>, psaltery<WH5035> and harp<WH3658>: I myself will awake<WH5782> early<WH7837>.
I will praise<WH3034> you<WH3068>, O Lord, among the people<WH5971>: and I will sing praises<WH2167> unto you among the nations<WH3816>.
For your mercy<WH2617> is great<WH1419> above the heavens<WH8064>: and your truth<WH571> reaches unto the clouds<WH7834>.
Be you exalted<WH7311>, O God<WH430>, above the heavens<WH8064>: and your glory<WH3519> above all the earth<WH776>;
That your beloved<WH3039> may be delivered<WH2502>: save<WH3467> with your right hand<WH3225>, and answer me<WH6030>.
God<WH430> has spoken<WH1696> in his holiness<WH6944>; I will rejoice<WH5937>, I will divide<WH2505> Shechem<WH7927>, and measure out<WH4058> the valley<WH6010> of Succoth<WH5523>.
Gilead<WH1568> is mine<WH4519>; Manasseh is mine<WH669>; Ephraim also is the strength<WH4581> of my head<WH7218>; Judah<WH3063> is my lawgiver<WH2710>;
Moab<WH4124> is my washpot<WH7366>; over Edom<WH123> will I cast out<WH7993> my shoe<WH5275>; over Philistia<WH6429> will I triumph<WH7321>.
Who will bring<WH2986> me into the strong<WH4013> city<WH5892>? who will lead<WH5148> me into Edom<WH123>?
Will not you<WH430>, O God, who have cast us off<WH2186>? and will not you<WH430>, O God, go forth<WH3318> with our hosts<WH6635>?
Give<WH3051> us help<WH5833> from trouble<WH6862>: for vain<WH7723> is the help<WH8668> of man<WH120>.
Through God<WH430> we shall do<WH6213> valiantly<WH2428>: for he it is that shall tread down<WH947> our enemies<WH6862>.
